mechanoreception.notes: As sponges, Ancorinidae likely possess mechanoreceptors to detect water currents and physical stimuli. This is inferred based on the general physiology of sponges.

chemoreception.notes: Sponges, including Ancorinidae, rely on chemoreception to detect chemical cues in the water for feeding and other physiological processes. This is a fundamental aspect of sponge biology.

photoreception.notes: The presence or absence of photoreception in Ancorinidae is currently unknown based on the provided context. Further research is needed to determine if these sponges possess any light-sensitive cells or structures.
